Rule.Name: rtlfiles
Rule.Title: Log files are available in this scan
Rule.Text:
Log files are available in this scan. Click the 'Configuration Details' tile and then select the 'Collected Log Files' tab to view the files collected during this scan.
- {0} - {1} {2}

Event.Name: CssOutboxEvtSendMessage
Event.Message: A message is being sent from Outlook

Event.Name: CssOutboxEvtRopSM
Event.Message: Outlook has asked Exchange to accept submission of the message

Event.Name: CssOutboxEvtRopTS
Event.Message: Outlook has asked Exchange to deliver the message

Event.Name: CssOutboxEvtOutboxSubject
Event.Message: Subject: {0}

Event.Name: CssOutboxEvtMTSISuccess
Event.Message: The message has been successfully moved to the Sent Items Folder

Event.Name: CssOutboxEvtOutboxNDR
Event.Message: Outlook is generating a non-delivery report for the message. The reason is: {0}

PayloadValue.Text: Outlook did not have enough information to determine a specific reason
None of your mail accounts could deliver mail with this type of email address

Event.Name: CssOutboxEvtOutMsgTotal
Event.Message: Total count of potential messages to send = {0}

Event.Name: CssOutboxEvtOutMsgFinal
Event.Message: Final count of potential messages to send = {0}

Event.Name: CssOutboxEvtAddMsgToTableRowAdded
Event.Message: One message has been added to the outgoing messages table

Event.Name: CssOutboxEvtPSPStart
Event.Message: Post-submission processing has started

Event.Name: CssOutboxEvtPSPStart
Event.Message: Post-submission processing has ended. Result = {0}

Event.Name: CssOutboxEvtMTSICopy
Event.Message: Ready to move to Sent Items Folder

Event.Name: CssOutboxEvtMTSIDelete
Event.Message: Outlook is deleting the sent item based on user settings

Event.Name: CssOutboxEvtMTSISuccess
Event.Message: The message was successfully moved to Sent Items

Event.Name: CssOutboxEvtMTSIEnd
Event.Message: The attempt to move the message to Sent Items resulted in: {0}

Event.Name: CssOutboxEvtOutMsgSkipDef
Event.Message: Not sending because deferred delivery time is set for this message

Event.Name: CssOutboxEvtOutMsgSkipStore
Event.Message: Skipping a store while collecting messages to send because {0}

PayloadValue.Text: this is an archive store.
this is a shared mailbox store.
this is a public folder store.

Event.Name: CssOutboxEvtOutMsgSkipSub
Event.Message: Skipping message because it is not in submitted state

Event.Name: CssOutboxEvtPSMSI
Event.Message: 'Send immediately when connected' preference is {0}

PayloadValue.Text: unchecked (or the profile is in online mode).

Event.Name: CssOutboxEvtSAPMStart
Event.Message: Starting sending of all pending messages

Event.Name: CssOutboxEvtSAPMEnd
Event.Message: Finished sending of all pending messages. Result = {0}

Event.Message: Getting list of messages to send for store '{0}'

PayloadValue.Text: Outlook processed this message as a junk message.
Outlook processed this message as a phishing message
Outlook processed this message as a spoofing message

Event.Name: CssEvtJunkData
Event.Message: Threshold: {0}, SCL: {1}, PCL: {2}

PayloadValue.Text: The message is a header-only item, and not eligible for junk mail scanning.
The message is already trusted (Spam Confidence Level = -1).
The Junk mail Filter is disabled by policy.
An error occurred while trying to open the default junk mail folder.
An error occurred while trying to open the default junk mail folder.
Messages in deleted items, drafts, outbox, sent items, sync issues subfolders are not scanned.
Messages in public folder favorites are not scanned.
Messages in public folder shortcuts favorites are not scanned.
The junk mail options could not be retrieved.
An error occurred opening the containing folder of the message.
Messages of this type are not eligible for junk mail scanning.
An error occurred while retrieving basic properties from the message that are required for junk mail scanning.
Unknown scan type.
An error occurred while retrieving extended properties from the message that are required for junk mail scanning.
Outlook is scanning the message for phishing status only or the message is already in the junk mail folder.
The sender is trusted.
An unexpected memory error prevented the scanning process from completing successfully.
The recipient is trusted.
The sender is blocked.
The domain is trusted.
Either the sender's domain is blocked, the encoding used in this message is blocked, or the sender's address suffix is blocked.
The level of junk mail protection is set to 'No Automatic Filtering'.
the level of junk mail protection is set to 'Safe Lists Only'.
The message was sent to the junk mail filter, and the filter returned this decision on whether the message should be considered junk.
This is a system message, not visible to the user, and is not eligible for junk mail scanning.
This mail store doesn't support junk mail filtering.
The message is not in a folder that is eligible for junk mail scanning.
The message is NOT marked as junk.
The message *IS* marked as junk.
Junk mail scanning has started for a message
Junk mail scanning has ended for a message

Event.Name: CssEvtJunkSubjectA
Event.Message: Subject: {0}

Event.Name: CssEvtJunkSubjectW
Event.Message: Subject: {0}

PayloadValue.Text: Outlook processed this message as a junk message

Event.Name: EvtOABDownloadState
Event.Message: Download state = {0}

Event.Name: OabOabEvtAsyncLastDownloadTime
Event.Message: Offline Address Book last asynchronous download time = {0}

Event.Name: OabOabEvtAsyncOabDownload
Event.Message: Starting asynchronous Offline Address Book download

Event.Name: OabOabEvtBeginDownloadDiffOab
Event.Message: Starting differential Offline Address Book download

Event.Name: OabOabEvtBeginDownloadFilesUsingBITS
Event.Message: Starting Offline Address Book download using Background Intelligent Transfer Service

Event.Name: OabOabEvtBeginDownloadFullOab
Event.Message: Starting full Offline Address Book download

Event.Name: OabOabEvtBeginDownloadOabXML
Event.Message: Downloading Offline Address Book XML to local path '{0}'

Event.Name: OabOabEvtDecompressAddrFileV4
Event.Message: Decompressing Offline Address Book file '{0}'

Event.Name: OabOabEvtDownloadBegin
Event.Message: Starting Offline Address Book download

Event.Name: OabOabEvtDownloadEnd
Event.Message: Finished Offline Address Book download

Event.Name: OabOabEvtDownloadLimitCheck
Event.Message: Checking Offline Address Book ({0}) download limit. Now is {1}, last attempt was {2}, previous attempt was {3}, max attempts is {4}

Event.Name: OabOabEvtDumpOALData
Event.Message: List of files to download using HTTP (obtained from OAB.XML). BaseUrl: {0}, OabGuid: {1}, OabDN: {2}, OabName: {3}

Event.Name: OabOabEvtEndDownloadFilesUsingBITS
Event.Message: Files successfully downloaded via Background Intelligent Transfer Service

Event.Name: OabOabEvtLastModifiedTime
Event.Message: Offline Address Book last modified time

Event.Name: OabOabEvtRenameFile
Event.Message: Renaming Offline Address Book file

Event.Name: OabOabEvtScheduleSync
Event.Message: Scheduling the Offline Address Book download

Event.Name: OabOabEvtTaskResult
Event.Message: Offline Address Book Synchronisation Result = {1}

Event.Name: OabOabEvtTriggerFulDownload
Event.Message: Offline Address Book full download. Reason = {0}

PayloadValue.Text: You do not have any Offline Address Book files on your computer, or the Offline Address Book files could not be opened for some other reason
You forced a full Offline Address Book file download manually
The name of the Offline Address Book could not be obtained on the client. This behavior occurs when you create a new profile.
The GUID of the Offline Address Book could not be obtained on the client.
The name of the Offline Address Book was missing from the server. In this case, a full Offline Address Book download is not expected to start or succeed, but it is logged anyway.
The GUID of the Offline Address Book was missing from the server. In this case, the full Offline Address Book file download is not expected to start or succeed, but it is logged anyway.
The server's Offline Address Book name and the client's Offline Address Book name are different.

The server's GUID and the client's GUID are different. This behavior can occur if the server had to regenerate a whole new Offline Address Book with the same name and then discarded the old set. Or, the client was moved between different forests.
The client's sequence number is bigger than the server.

You want detailed information in the Offline Address Book, but there is no (u)details.oab file on your client. This behavior may occur if you manually force a download of the Offline Address Book, and then you click to clear the Download changes since last Send/Receive check box.
At least one update file was missing from the server.
The sum total of the update files to download may not be greater than 1/8 (v3) or 1/2 (v4) of the full Offline Address Book files.
You have the 'Allow SRS Full OAB Download' registry key set to 1, and your Send/Receive setting was set to always do a full download.

You do not have the locale of the Offline Address Book installed on your system, and you did a manual full Offline Address Book download. Typically, Outlook updates the address book either once a month, when a conditions hits for such users, or when you download manually. Outlook uses these three methods to update the address book to avoid a condition that would cause a full download every day.
Applying the update file to the .oab file failed for some reason.
Applying the update file to the .oab file failed for some reason.

Event.Name: OabOabEvtXMLPath
Event.Message: Path to where we got the OAB.XML

Event.Name: EmsmdbOabEvtAsyncDownload
Event.Message: Start asynchronous Offline Address Book download

Event.Name: EmsmdbOabEvtAsyncLastDownloadTime
Event.Message: Offline Address Book was last downloaded on {0} (local time)

Event.Name: EmsmdbOabEvtBeginDownloadDiffOab
Event.Message: Starting differential Offline Address Book download

Event.Name: EmsmdbOabEvtBeginDownloadFilesUsingBITS
Event.Message: Starting Offline Address Book download with Background Intelligent Transfer Service. Job description: {0}, URL: {1}, Manual download: {2}, NumberOfFilesToDownload: {3}, FileName: {4}

Event.Name: EmsmdbOabEvtBeginDownloadFullOab
Event.Message: Starting full Offline Address Book download

Event.Name: EmsmdbOabEvtBeginDownloadOabXML
Event.Message: Downloading OAB.XML to local path: {0}

Event.Name: EmsmdbOabEvtDecompressAddrFileV4
Event.Message: Decompressing Offline Address Book file. File: {0}

Event.Name: EmsmdbOabEvtDownloadBegin
Event.Message: Starting Offline Address Book download

Event.Name: EmsmdbOabEvtDownloadEnd
Event.Message: Finished Offline Address Book download

Event.Name: EmsmdbOabEvtDownloadLimitCheck

Event.Name: EmsmdbOabEvtDumpOALData
Event.Message: List of files to download using HTTP (obtained from OAB.XML). BaseUrl: {0}, OabGuid: {1}, OabDN: {2}, OabName: {3}

Event.Name: EmsmdbOabEvtEndDownloadFilesUsingBITS
Event.Message: Files successfully downloaded via Background Intelligent Transfer Service

Event.Name: EmsmdbOabEvtLastModifiedTime
Event.Message: Offline Address Book was last modified on {0}

Event.Name: EmsmdbOabEvtOabXMLPath
Event.Message: OAB.XML downloaded from '{0}'

Event.Name: EmsmdbOabEvtRenameFile
Event.Message: Renaming Offline Address Book file '{0}' to '{1}'

Event.Message: Scheduling the Offline Address Book download

Event.Name: EmsmdbOabEvtTaskResult
Event.Message: Task '{0}' resulted in {1}

PayloadValue.Text: Scheduling the Offline Address Book download
Offline Address Book Download using Background Intelligent Transfer Service
Move and Decompress one Offline Address Book v4 file
More info
Download incremental Offline Address Book
The user cancelled the operation
Not needed

Event.Name: EmsmdbOabEvtTriggerFulDownload
Event.Message: Full Offline Address Book download reason: {0}

PayloadValue.Text: You do not have any Offline Address Book files on your computer, or the Offline Address Book files could not be opened for some other reason
You forced a full .oab file download manually
The name of the Offline Address Book could not be obtained on the client. This behavior occurs when you create a new profile.
The GUID of the Offline Address Book could not be obtained on the client.
The name of the Offline Address Book was missing from the server. In this case, a full .oab file download is not expected to start or succeed, but it is logged anyway.
The GUID of the Offline Address Book was missing from the server. In this case, the full .oab file download is not expected to start or succeed, but it is logged anyway.
The server's Offline Address Book name and the client's Offline Address Book name are different.

The server's GUID and the client's GUID are different. This behavior can occur if the server had to regenerate a whole new Offline Address Book with the same name and then discarded the old set. Or, the client was moved between different forests.
The client's sequence number is bigger than the server.

You want detailed information in the Offline Address Book, but there is no detailed .oab file on your client. This behavior may occur if you manually force a download of the Offline Address Book, and then you click to clear the Download changes since last Send/Receive check box.
At least one update file was missing from the server.
The sum total of the update files to download may not be greater than 1/8 (v3) or 1/2 (v4) of the full .oab file.
You have the 'Allow SRS Full OAB Download' registry key set to 1, and your Send/Receive setting was set to always do a full download.

You do not have the locale of the Offline Address Book installed on your system, and you did a manual full .oab file download. Typically, Outlook updates the address book either once a month, when a conditions hits for such users, or when you download manually. Outlook uses these three methods to update the address book to avoid a condition that would cause a full download every day.
Applying the update file to the .oab file failed for some reason.
Applying the update file to the .oab file failed for some reason.
